results.title: Asterix the Gaul
results.brief_description: Asterix, the adventurous hero is the cunning little warrior to whom all perilous missions are immediately entrusted. Thanks to the magic potion of the Druid, he is famed for his superhuman strength. As if that were not enough, his mighty friend, Obelix is always ready to drop everything to go off on a new adventure with Asterix, although he is never allowed to have a portion of the magic potion because he fell into it when he was a baby. Wherever excitement and danger reigns, you can be sure that our intrepid pair will be in the thick of it. So Romans beware, here comes Asterix the Gaul. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Asterix in Britain
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Dargaud Films, Yannik Piel and Pino Van Lamsweerde
results.brief_description: The world-famous comic-strip character, that madcap Gaul, Asterix is brought to life in this animated feature. The battle skills of the Britons are undeniably the equal of Caesar’s Roman troops. However, they are handicapped by their habit of refusing to fight on weekends and leaving the battlefield promptly at five every afternoon in time for tea. Whilst the Britons are caught napping after dinner, the Romans win the war and overrun Britain. A plea from the English leader, Zebigboss, goes out to the mighty Asterix and his Roman-hating friend Obelix. Join all the familiar friends in this great adventure including Druid Getafix, Dogmatix, Chief Vitalstatistix, Cacofonix and many more. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaumont-British Instructional, Dargaud Films, Yannik Piel and Pino Van Lamsweerde

results.title: Asterix conquers America
results.creator_credit: Extrafilm Production, Jurgen Wohlrabe and Gerhard Hahn
results.brief_description: When a brawl breaks out between the Gauls and the Romans, the potion that gives Asterix and Obelix their powers tips over. Before more can be made, the Romans kidnap Getafix and hurl him into space, believing of course that the world is flat. When Asterix and Obelix go after him, they land in America, encountering strange animals and meeting a group of Indians. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Extrafilm Production, Jurgen Wohlrabe and Gerhard Hahn

results.title: Asterix and the Magic Cauldron for Spectrum 48/128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
Asterix and the Magic Cauldron is a single player adventure arcade game. Players control Asterix through various maps, collecting keys for locked doors and fighting Romans and boars in search of seven pieces of Getafix’s Magic Cauldron. Fights take place on a separate screen mode. Stamina bars for each combatant appear on the side of the window. Defeating the combatant adds it to the food tally. If Asterix loses the fight, the window closes and he loses a life. The same system is used when fighting the Roman soldiers and when Asterix picks up objects.

Obelix will only follow if Asterix has a supply of hams which can be obtained from fighting boars. Asterix starts with five lives and one dose of Magic Potion per game, which can be activated by double tapping the fire button.

Original game developed by Beam Software for ZX Spectrum 48K, published in 1986 by Melbourne House.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/asterix-and-the-magic-cauldron/

Last accessed: 1/05/2021

group_siblings.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cardboard cassette case and plastic cassette tray.

results.title: Asterix and the big fight
results.creator_credit: ExtraFilm Produktion, Gaumont, Nicolas Pesques and Philippe Grimond
results.brief_description: In this, the sixth animated Asterix feature, Asterix, Obelix and their faithful canine Dogmatix are left alone to defend their village against the Romans after the rest of the villagers have fled from a terrible thunderstorm. Unfortunately for them the druid Getafix has lost his memory after being accidently knocked unconscious with a menhir by Obelix and is unable to remember the formula for the potion that gives Asterix the superhuman strength he relies on to defeat the Romans. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Asterix and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Dargaud Films, Yannik Piel and Pino Van Lamsweerde
results.brief_description: Thanks to the magic potion made by a Druid, Asterix the tiny Gaul has mighty powers. With his pal Obelix they make life miserable for the Roman soldiers unlucky enough to live near their village. This adventure finds our heroes in Egypt. The Egyptians are famous for their pyramids, but this doesn’t impress the Romans when every other building in Egypt is in danger of falling down. So when Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, has a blazing row with Julius Caesar, the Roman Emperor, it’s the start of an amazingly funny adventure for Asterix. His task is to build a palace fit for a queen in only a few weeks and win Cleopatra’s bet! Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Astacus (the crayfish)
results.brief_description: The crayfish is examined as an example of an animal having an external skeleton; the function and structure of each individual part of the skeleton is studied. Detailed consideration is given to the male and female reproductive organs, the arterial system, the nervous system, and the process of feeding and digestion.

results.title: Assorted Film Making Accessories
results.brief_description: “Coated Walz Filter for Color Film housed in original cardboard box. Walz brand clear plastic case with lid and base. Metal rimmed light brown/orange glass lens. Instructions included Kodak Kodachrome 25 colour movie film daylight for 8mm roll (7.5m KM459P) Tin can embossed with Kodak logo on the top. Unused reel of film. Tin sealed together with black duct tape. Original box Envelope Instructions Film price includes processing by Kodak. Mailing envelope enclosed (this has never been used and is folded in a small square) 7.5 metres in length of douible 8mm film on this roll which is intended to yield 15 metres in length of 8mm movies. The additional film at each end serves as leader and trailer for light protection and camera loading. Process before Oct 1979. KM459P CAT 416 9918 Daylight, ASA 25, 15 DIN 2 pairs of mono ear buds to be plugged in to a crystal radio. 1. Brown leather pouch with pink ear bud. 2. Black vinyl puch with cream ear bud. Sunbeam lens brush. Sundry cord in ziplock bag. National brand. Could possibly have been a cord to connect flash. However there doesn’t see to be a donated item which this pairs with. Cyldon brand film reel. (for 8mm) Light metal (tin?). Made in England Markers for 50, 100, 150 and 200 feet.”

results.title: Association Football. Pt. 3. Coaching in the game
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Football Association and George Sturt
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Looks specifically at field positions and strategies of attack and defence. Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.
